title: Select Medical Holdings' (NYSE:SEM) Earnings May Just Be The Starting Point
description: NYSE:SEM 1 Year Share Price vs Fair Value Explore Select Medical Holdings's Fair Values from the Community and select...
content:
Explore Select Medical Holdings's Fair Values from the Community and select yours



Select Medical Holdings Corporation's (NYSE:SEM) earnings announcement last week was disappointing for investors, despite the decent profit numbers. We did some digging and actually think they are being unnecessarily pessimistic.

This technology could replace computers: discover the 20 stocks are working to make quantum computing a reality.

The Impact Of Unusual Items On Profit

To properly understand Select Medical Holdings' profit results, we need to consider the US$29m expense attributed to unusual items. It's never great to see unusual items costing the company profits, but on the upside, things might improve sooner rather than later. We looked at thousands of listed companies and found that unusual items are very often one-off in nature. And, after all, that's exactly what the accounting terminology implies. If Select Medical Holdings doesn't see those unusual expenses repeat, then all else being equal we'd expect its profit to increase over the coming year.

That might leave you wondering what analysts are forecasting in terms of future profitability. Luckily, you can click here to see an interactive graph depicting future profitability, based on their estimates.

Our Take On Select Medical Holdings' Profit Performance

Unusual items (expenses) detracted from Select Medical Holdings' earnings over the last year, but we might see an improvement next year. Because of this, we think Select Medical Holdings' earnings potential is at least as good as it seems, and maybe even better! And one can definitely find a positive in the fact that it made a profit this year, despite losing money last year. Of course, we've only just scratched the surface when it comes to analysing its earnings; one could also consider margins, forecast growth, and return on investment, among other factors. Keep in mind, when it comes to analysing a stock it's worth noting the risks involved. Every company has risks, and we've spotted 2 warning signs for Select Medical Holdings (of which 1 is significant!) you should know about.

Today we've zoomed in on a single data point to better understand the nature of Select Medical Holdings' profit. But there are plenty of other ways to inform your opinion of a company. For example, many people consider a high return on equity as an indication of favorable business economics, while others like to 'follow the money' and search out stocks that insiders are buying. While it might take a little research on your behalf, you may find this free collection of companies boasting high return on equity, or this list of stocks with significant insider holdings to be useful.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.



This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
summary: Select Medical Holdings Corporation (NYSE:SEM)'s ($29m expense attributed to unusual items) may lead to an increase in profits over the next year, despite the company's disappointing profit numbers. The article suggests that unusual items are often one-off in nature and that if these expenses are not repeated, the profit for Select Medical Holdings is expected to increase over the coming year. However, it also highlights that the company made a profit this year despite losing money last year. Furthermore, an interactive graph depicts future profitability based on analysts' estimates suggests that future profitability will increase. The author also highlights two potential warning signs for select Medical Holdings, one of which is significant.
shortSummary: Select Medical Holdings' earnings report was disappointing due to unusual items, but potential for future improvements due to ongoing financial stability and high returns may still exist.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1996 | 37,050 | David Chernow | www.selectmedical.com |
Select Medical Holdings Corporation, through its subsidiaries, operates critical illness recovery hospitals, rehabilitation hospitals, and outpatient rehabilitation clinics in the United States. It operates through three segments: Critical Illness Recovery Hospital, Rehabilitation Hospital, and Outpatient Rehabilitation. The Critical Illness Recovery Hospital segment consists of hospitals that provide services for heart failure, infectious disease, respiratory failure and pulmonary disease, surgery requiring prolonged recovery, renal disease, neurological events, and trauma.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1996 | 37,050 | David Chernow | www.selectmedical.com |
Select Medical Holdings Corporation, through its subsidiaries, operates critical illness recovery hospitals, rehabilitation hospitals, and outpatient rehabilitation clinics in the United States. It operates through three segments: Critical Illness Recovery Hospital, Rehabilitation Hospital, and Outpatient Rehabilitation. The Critical Illness Recovery Hospital segment consists of hospitals that provide services for heart failure, infectious disease, respiratory failure and pulmonary disease, surgery requiring prolonged recovery, renal disease, neurological events, and trauma.

argos_summary: Select Medical Holdings Corporation's recent earnings report disappointed investors, primarily due to a $29 million expense from unusual items that affected profits. Analysts believe these unusual expenses may not recur, suggesting potential for improved profitability in the coming year. Despite past declines in earnings, Select Medical has shown a profit this year, indicating a possible turnaround, although investors should remain aware of associated risks.
